detaileddescription.para: "Simple layers" are used when a widget has style_opa < 255 to buffer the widget into a layer and blend it as an image with the given opacity. Note that bg_opa, text_opa etc don't require buffering into layer) The widget can be buffered in smaller chunks to avoid using large buffers.

listitem.para: LV_LAYER_SIMPLE_BUF_SIZE: [bytes] the optimal target buffer size. LVGL will try to allocate it
LV_LAYER_SIMPLE_FALLBACK_BUF_SIZE: [bytes] used if LV_LAYER_SIMPLE_BUF_SIZE couldn't be allocated.

detaileddescription.para: Both buffer sizes are in bytes. "Transformed layers" (where transform_angle/zoom properties are used) use larger buffers and can't be drawn in chunks. So these settings affects only widgets with opacity.

memberdef.name: LV_USE_ASSERT_NULL
memberdef.initializer: 1 /*Check if the parameter is NULL. (Very fast, recommended)*/

memberdef.name: LV_USE_ASSERT_MALLOC
memberdef.initializer: 1 /*Checks is the memory is successfully allocated or no. (Very fast, recommended)*/

memberdef.initializer: 0 /*Check if the styles are properly initialized. (Very fast, recommended)*/

memberdef.name: LV_USE_ASSERT_MEM_INTEGRITY
memberdef.initializer: 0 /*Check the integrity of `lv_mem` after critical operations. (Slow)*/

memberdef.name: LV_USE_ASSERT_OBJ
memberdef.initializer: 0 /*Check the object's type and existence (e.g. not deleted). (Slow)*/
